Package org.somox.filter.tests

Class EclipseAstFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.somox.filter.tests.EclipseAstFactory
  • public class EclipseAstFactory
extends Object
    Handles creation of Compilation Units from java files. This class is thread safe.

    To enable this class to optimise its performance, it should be instantiated as infrequently as possible. Usually, one instance can be used throughout the whole runtime.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompilationUnit

        public org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit getCompilationUnit​(Path path)
                                                            throws IOException
        Reads in the Java file at the provided path and returns the CompilationUnit found in the file.

        Calling this method with the argument path is equivalent to calling this.getCompilationUnit(path, false).

        Parameters:
        path - The path to a Java file.
        Returns:
        The compilation representing the java file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If reading in the file at path fails.

      • getCompilationUnit

        public org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit getCompilationUnit​(Path path,
                                                                   boolean withBindings)
                                                            throws IOException
        Reads in the Java file at the provided path and returns the CompilationUnit found in the file. If withBindings is true, the returned compilation unit will have resolved bindings. Bindings are useful to gain information about referenced types, methods, and more, but have a significant impact on time and space when creating the AST. See ASTParser.setResolveBindings(boolean) for more information. If bindings are being resolved, bindings recovery will be enabled.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to a Java file.
        withBindings - Whether to resolve bindings while creating the AST.
        Returns:
        The compilation unit representing the java file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If reading the file at path fails.

      • getCompilationUnit

        public org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit getCompilationUnit​(org.eclipse.jdt.core.ICompilationUnit compilationUnit,
                                                                   boolean withBindings)
                                                            throws IOException
        Returns the AST CompilationUnit of the provided JDT ICompilationUnit. If withBindings is true, the returned compilation unit will have resolved bindings. Bindings are useful to gain information about referenced types, methods, and more, but have a significant impact on time and space when creating the AST. See ASTParser.setResolveBindings(boolean) for more information. If bindings are being resolved, bindings recovery will be enabled.
        Parameters:
        compilationUnit - A JDT compilation unit.
        withBindings - Whether to resolve bindings while creating the AST.
        Returns:
        The compilation unit representing the java file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If reading the file at path fails.
